Description: Fragment of rim from East Greek pottery eye-cup; interior glazed; exterior, one eye and eyebrow in black outline fired red in parts, with trace of further decoration to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 227, no. 135)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 105, pl. XXXII, no. 312.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.32)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4823 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
